Review Text: We saw the golden tulip apartments festac on trip advisor and decided to give it a try being that we were traveling with kids and preferred to stay in an apartment! Everything was going averagely then a humongous RAT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Showed up !!!! The apartments could also be much cleaner .

First of all, it is no longer the Golden Tulip but rather the Festival Hotel as it has been sold. They didn't bother to tell anybody and you can still book through the Golden Tulip site. The place is dilapidated, aircon is down in entire hotel, service is poor, rooms are small, credit card machines don't work. Breakfast had a nice selection but food not fresh. Not worth the price at all. Worst hotel in Lagos!

It was a most frustrating stay at this hotel. Got in around midday. My first encounter with how inefficient the front desk was. Had made a prior book via Hotel.com and paid for a room for US$ 68, 00 for one night. I came with a group who were booked on the 4th floor and therefore asked for a room on this floor. was tole I had to pay an additional Naira 21,824.70 = US$ 24, which adds up to US$ 92! When asked why was told because of the floor and I wanted to be with the group! The hotel is huge and most of the rooms were empty! No amount of reasoning helped. No explanation given! Got to the floor, it had a dank smell which the best of air fresheners could not conceal! The air conditioning was on but the room was hot! Made a complaint as did many others on the floor, were told it
Room Tips: Hotel is surrounded by high rise buildings of the hotel rooms.

Review Text: Golden Tulip, Festac Town is located at Amuwo Odofin, Mile 2 Estate.  The hotel share the same premises with Festival Mall otherwise known as Shopprites. The hotel was formerly known as Dubar Hotel with nice structures and good parking lots.   Check - in at the hotel was poor and the front desk still needs constant training and  retraining.  Room was clean and neatly set, but the bathroom and toiletries needs to be highly improved  improved upon.   Breakfast was so good and the pool was also cool.   In all I will rate hotel 2.5/ 05

Review Title: Family dinner and one night stay
Review Text: Nice hotel for Nigerian standards, I would say average from American perspective. Good pool area, bar, buffet restaurant and comfortable rooms. This was one of two places I saw other westerners during my 2 weeks in Nigeria.

This hotel is located on the mainland area of Festac, having spent virtually my whole day in traffic I was tired and was ready to hit my bed, I was greeted by the hotel supervisor who checked me in promptly, I had an extra person accompany so he upgraded us to the next standard of room with an additional bed complexly free of charge. He escorted us to the room and showed us how to use the available amenities Shower AC, Wi-Fi etc.  The room was spacious and vermin-free, I had a sound sleep‚Ä¶ All your typical mods and cons were available, AC unit was controlled via the wall control, a refrigerator and kettle we available with tea and coffee, and two bottles of water were provided. The room contained a desk and chair, along with a sofa and table. There were enough socket spaces for

We came here for a short stay and thoroughly had a good time! Planning to come back sometime soon. Helpful and courteous staff, well cooked meals and very clean room and bathroom. Had a well rested night i must confess.
Room Tips: Pool side view is great. The higher the floors the lesser the noise and the better the view

Review Title: One of the worst hotels ever
Review Text: I stayed for two night for a business trip. When I arrived they gave a room that the door was broken (it couldn‚Äôt close the door). The gave another room that it seemed that some slept before. I couldn‚Äôt pay when I made the check in. I other dinner to the room, the waiter very strange gay that called me to the room at 4AM. Unacceptable.  There wasn‚Äôt a safe box to keep my passport safe. I tried to pay 5th times but there was always a problem (they told it was my credit card, wasn‚Äôt true) I made a transfer because they told me that we the receipt from the bank would be enough it wasn‚Äôt true either. The girl from the front desk wasn‚Äôt giving me any solution. As far as I can I will never come back there.

The check in was good. Very friendly lady at the desk. The room needs to be upgraded. The furniture is outdated. The rug was dirty though swept clean. The bathroom has a bath tub. It was clean. The television set need to be changed. It was very far from a flat screen. The location of the hotel is another challenge. The long hours spent on the road is a big disappointment. The hotel have a swimming pool (i did not use it). The food at breakfast was okay. Though choices were few. There is a gym and a room for massage.

Worst ever hotel in Nigeria I have visited in last 12 years .... Never ever go there , no customer service , no politeness and super uncourteous staff .... Specialy the man at reception Mr Sunday ... Pathetic hotel , no class what so ever.
Review Text

Review Title: Chose for long stay, bitterly disappointed
Review Text: Check-in - Smooth, efficient. Required payment up-front, but that was o.k. as we chose to pay daily rather than for the entire planned 11 days. Room - Very poor quality furnishings, fixtures and fittings. Everything falling apart in the rooms - yes rooms!!, as we requested to be moved from a carpeted to a tiled room - guess what, the tiled room was more expensive!! And even though we were told the new room had been specially cleaned and provisioned for us, it was no better than the room we had moved from. Fridge, closet, tiles all in poor state of repair and actually falling apart. Big sign declared all guests to use safe for valuables... safe in our room did not work and it took 3 days for it to be fixed!!. Hallways stank and had heavily stained, carpets that were lifting in

Good hotel, everything worked well üëçüèæ  Keep up the good work,  Customer service and room service was good like the decor of the room and shop right opposite is also very convenient.  Very nice location

Had several customer conferences here and will not hesitate to use them again.  Although there was some issue initially with our refreshments, this was quickly sorted out and professionally too.  The grounds of the hotel is also home to sprawling Residences and a shopping mall.

Attended a conference at the hotel and decided to spend the night there. The rooms are terrible. The air conditioning didn't work. Ordered room service and more than half of what i ordered was not available. The internet in the room is rubbish. Service is also very poor. The hotel looks great from the outside but when you past the lobby, that is it, everything else is rubbish

stay was nice, staff very friendly. Rooms were not so clean, and backyard view is quite awful. Restaurant buffet is mostly the same every day, and menu (a la carte) nothing is available. We had to change meeting room during the week, for what reason??? It was an experience...

ƒ∞nternet connection is really terrible. I even could not talk on the phone for 5 secends and There is a bad smell in all the hotel Hope not to come here again.the only good thing is the helpful and smiling hotel stuff.

My family and I stayed over 10 nights at this hotel and did not have air conditioning for 8 of the nights.  The hotel provided us with a huge industrial fan instead that was very loud.  The room that we were placed in was very hard to get wifi connection. The hotel took 4 days to remedy that issue with the internet.  The buffet breakfast is included for one person and it provides a variety of foods for breakfast.  The yellow taxi or KKs are not allowed to drop you off or pick you up directly in front of the hotel due to theft issues and car break-ins.  It was nice that the mall is located nearby and gives more options for food.  The hotel food was way overpriced.  Room service takes over an hour to respond to any request. The hallway to the rooms have a smelly odor. Needs

Recently, I have stayed in this hotel during my business trip to Nigeria. I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The location of the hotel is excellent. The hotel lobby is very good. Room service is very nice. They offer buffet breakfast, lunch & dinner to every guests each day. The interior of the rooms are very good.

The decision to site the Festac Festival Mall in the same compound with this hotel is a disaster. There is no demarcation between the hotel  and  mall area so one is always "exposed" to a crowd. Expect strangers to approach your car at night to seek alms .  This also makes for long car queues whenever one is going in or out of the hotel as both facilities share a common gate.   As for hotel service, the food is good and delivered promptly via room service. However, it is an unpleasant experience to meet your food tray still not cleared from the passage hours after lunch.  Buffet breakfast provides a fair range of options -local and continental and wifi speed is commendable.

Hotel close to airport Staff delightful and extremely helpful Grounds lush and the frangapani tree's large and full of lowers heavenly perfume Food mainly Nigerian and spicy....... Salads fab And more than enough to choose from Bed comfortable and rooms spacious Needs some love and care to decor  a little tired Would visit again
Author Location: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates

Review Text: Review Text

6 of us popped in for a quick lunch. 2 hours before the final meal was served. Only 3 meals were hot food and 3 were salads! We were the only people in the restaurant.  Not to be recommended. Unless you want to wait 2 hours for a simple snack.   Food was very average when it turned up it was a hour between the first meal being served and the last one.

I came here for 3 nights on a business trip. My room was on the 6th floor, and the smell as you leave the elevators is strong and unpleasant.  The whole place smells one way or another, and it's generally run down, dirty and shabby. I travel frequently in sub-Saharan Africa, and this place is well below standard.  The safe in my room was locked, and couldn't be opened - despite asking for 3 days.  I didn't fancy eating in the hotel and was lucky enough to find a restaurant called Rhapsody, on the opposite side of the parking lot. Clean friendly and a great band on Sunday night.

The scenery, the staff, the food, and rooms were all very well set up and very helpful.  The shops were beautiful, the art was mesmerizing, and everything was so clean.  You guys, they had a complimentary breakfast buffet that was a perfect way to wake up and fill yourself.  Air conditioning felt great coming  in from outside, which was a huge relief coming from a girl who lives in a cold region of the United States.  I loved the huge tub! I could soak there for  hours! No complaints, just wish I brought more money so I could stay there for the month that I was in town.  Great job everyone.

We stayed and booked a conference room for a meeting with our clients.  They were able to perform the services very well.  The place ris neat and clean and services and staff are superb! They were able to provide us with excellent services and we are so happy.

Review Title: On the verge of perfection- It has all you need
Review Text: This is a non-smoking hotel The rooms are big and spacious. The hotel shares a compound with a mall and  two other restaurants giving you lots of options without leaving the hotel compound The compound has ample paid parking, but you get a waiver if you lodge in the hotel It was quiet while I was there  The toilets  were super clean and quite modern  Adequate and fast elevators Room decor is good but the carpet and sheets look worn out.  We had a fridge,  kettle for hot water , TV, Desk and Chair The air seemed slightly stale, however it the air quality is fair. A bit of cosmetic improvements will alter it to a much higher grade. overall it is an okay place to stay if you are within FESTAC environs It has all you need as a traveler. I totally enjoyed the breakfast buffet.

This hotel stinks everywhere, from the rooms to the lobby to the restaurants, everything is smelling of dampness, stayed for 7 days but those 7 days cannot forget ever, the only saving grace is the pool area where u can at least breath Air .... Food was ok ok, must mention about the Indian Chef who took good care for us and prepared some Indian dishes, God knows what we would have done without him, THANK YOU Chef !!

Review Title: Pretty place annoying front desk officer
Review Text: Stopped by to visit a friend who was a guest. We all went to see a late night movie and on getting back, the guy at the front desk beckoned rudely on my friend who is a guest. He said he acted that way because he wanted to find out if we had signed in earlier. It was just plain rude.

today, just now i am in the hotel. i ve been trying to sleep for 2 hours but a noise comes from another room. two times i called reception and nothing happened. probably one more time i am going to call then after i go to room and talk to the other guest or staff whoever makes this damn noise. i couldn t sleep i couldn t get rest. take into consideration this review before coming to hotel.

air conditioning was very poor. Food was good. they had indian cuisine as well and nearby ocean basket restaurant for a good variety of sea food. festival mall was at a walking distance for some small shopping kind of thing.

It's sad but this hotel is clearly past its best days. Central AC was down for 2 days while I was there...terrible heat. No official explanation was given. Room smelt damp, fittings were broken. Refrigerator was leaking. Clearly this once good hotel has lost its way.
Review Text

Review Title: Pretty place annoying front desk officer
Review Text: Stopped by to visit a friend who was a guest. We all went to see a late night movie and on getting back, the guy at the front desk beckoned rudely on my friend who is a guest. He said he acted that way because he wanted to find out if we had signed in earlier. It was just plain rude.

today, just now i am in the hotel. i ve been trying to sleep for 2 hours but a noise comes from another room. two times i called reception and nothing happened. probably one more time i am going to call then after i go to room and talk to the other guest or staff whoever makes this damn noise. i couldn t sleep i couldn t get rest. take into consideration this review before coming to hotel.

air conditioning was very poor. Food was good. they had indian cuisine as well and nearby ocean basket restaurant for a good variety of sea food. festival mall was at a walking distance for some small shopping kind of thing.

It's sad but this hotel is clearly past its best days. Central AC was down for 2 days while I was there...terrible heat. No official explanation was given. Room smelt damp, fittings were broken. Refrigerator was leaking. Clearly this once good hotel has lost its way.
Review Text

6 of us popped in for a quick lunch. 2 hours before the final meal was served. Only 3 meals were hot food and 3 were salads! We were the only people in the restaurant.  Not to be recommended. Unless you want to wait 2 hours for a simple snack.   Food was very average when it turned up it was a hour between the first meal being served and the last one.

I came here for 3 nights on a business trip. My room was on the 6th floor, and the smell as you leave the elevators is strong and unpleasant.  The whole place smells one way or another, and it's generally run down, dirty and shabby. I travel frequently in sub-Saharan Africa, and this place is well below standard.  The safe in my room was locked, and couldn't be opened - despite asking for 3 days.  I didn't fancy eating in the hotel and was lucky enough to find a restaurant called Rhapsody, on the opposite side of the parking lot. Clean friendly and a great band on Sunday night.

The scenery, the staff, the food, and rooms were all very well set up and very helpful.  The shops were beautiful, the art was mesmerizing, and everything was so clean.  You guys, they had a complimentary breakfast buffet that was a perfect way to wake up and fill yourself.  Air conditioning felt great coming  in from outside, which was a huge relief coming from a girl who lives in a cold region of the United States.  I loved the huge tub! I could soak there for  hours! No complaints, just wish I brought more money so I could stay there for the month that I was in town.  Great job everyone.

We stayed and booked a conference room for a meeting with our clients.  They were able to perform the services very well.  The place ris neat and clean and services and staff are superb! They were able to provide us with excellent services and we are so happy.

Review Title: On the verge of perfection- It has all you need
Review Text: This is a non-smoking hotel The rooms are big and spacious. The hotel shares a compound with a mall and  two other restaurants giving you lots of options without leaving the hotel compound The compound has ample paid parking, but you get a waiver if you lodge in the hotel It was quiet while I was there  The toilets  were super clean and quite modern  Adequate and fast elevators Room decor is good but the carpet and sheets look worn out.  We had a fridge,  kettle for hot water , TV, Desk and Chair The air seemed slightly stale, however it the air quality is fair. A bit of cosmetic improvements will alter it to a much higher grade. overall it is an okay place to stay if you are within FESTAC environs It has all you need as a traveler. I totally enjoyed the breakfast buffet.

This hotel stinks everywhere, from the rooms to the lobby to the restaurants, everything is smelling of dampness, stayed for 7 days but those 7 days cannot forget ever, the only saving grace is the pool area where u can at least breath Air .... Food was ok ok, must mention about the Indian Chef who took good care for us and prepared some Indian dishes, God knows what we would have done without him, THANK YOU Chef !!
